text:
Hey all,
I have to send an email from my system to a groups of contacts. I created groups of contacts using *Create a new contact list API.* Now i want to send and email of profile percentage and reach out to 100% profile to all different groups of contacts as per there profile completion percentage. How can i send automated email to all groups of contacts using dashboard. Please suggest me a steps to sent an automated email to groups of contacts.
Thanks in advanced.

No associations are displayed after this call.
On Friday these links were showing associations, but since yesterday they are not.
There is the is for send api, where you could send them an automated email. You must make sure you set your email as an automated email for it to work properly

Hi all,
I am experiencing an issue whilst using the contact creation API.  I am getting a `409 Conflict` response when I create a contact using the API even though no contact exists with the supplied email.  I can see that the contact does in fact get created in HubSpot, and the contact ID I get in the `409` response references that newly created contact.  The API request is being sent from the backend of the system written in Kotlin on customer registration.  The end point I am using is `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>` .  Any ideas why this might be happening? Thanks

I am using the latest version but yes, hinting is how I figured out the working version of the function in the first place.

As far as the date goes, the timeline API actually wants the date in the format I layed out, not as a unix timestamp. The function toISOString() is in theory what should be converting the date to unix. However, even if I do try unix, I get the exact same error.
I'm also guessing that is doesn't allow nesting. But I'll give your idea a shot as a last hope! Thanks for the suggestion

Hi all.  I’m having problems validating X-HubSpot-signature-v3 on the webhook receiver. I can’t  get the same hash as the one coming from HubSpot. python code snippet
```incomingSignature = 'mZCtEjHkQE7MIizLrNfk9Ur9nfYhCFczc3p1FRH+skw='
CLIENT_SECRET = "xxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxx";
method = "GET"
url = "<https://datafetch.free.beeceptor.com/?userId=18650279&userEmail=xxxxx-xxxx%2Bdev@xxxxx.io&associatedObjectId=4864055002&associatedObjectType=DEAL&portalId=25963540&hs_object_id=4864055002>"  
timestamp = "1661271861136"
concatenate_string = urllib.parse.unquote(f"{method}{url}{timestamp}")
signature_hash = hmac.new(
  CLIENT_SECRET.encode(),
  msg=concatenate_string.encode(),
  digestmod=hashlib.sha256
)
generate_signature = base64.b64encode(signature_hash.digest())
if generate_signature != signature_v3:
  print("doesn't match")```
<@UFBNA9K9A> can you help out with this one?

Does anyone know anything about the new object type Postal Mail? It's object type is 0-116
Just started showing up in the schemas api this morning
It also shows up as an enrollment trigger in workflows
Doesn't show up in GraphiQL editor though

Not 100% sure since I’m not a python dev but I think `hashlib.sha256` needs to be a function invocation like `hashlib.sha256()` in you `hmac.new()` call from what I can see <https://docs.python.org/3/library/hashlib.html#hashlib.new|on the docs>
Above snippet exact  same as
cc <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1645548417588109?thread_ts=1644268381.771139&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
<@UFBNA9K9A>
Hey <@U03L2QUGPK3> I’m not sure I understand what you are trying to say here. The example I wrote is in Node.js, I wouldn’t expect it to work in Python

So What I am trying to say here is above python snippet is equivalent of node js snippet you share in conversation
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1644268381771139>
As I am facing same issue  as define in above conversation
Did you try making the change I suggested above?
yes
your node-js snippet and python snippet generate same  signature
then what’s not working?
I can’t get the same hash as the one coming from HubSpot.
Using above  python snippet or node-js snippet
Well the node js one did work at some point, let me see if I can recreate the issue
I confirmed the node sample still works, so I’m not sure why you are seeing it not match. I also decided to take a shot at Python directly and go it working wiht this code:

```method = "GET"
url = "<https://webhook.site/27507627-3de7-4e3e-a924-dac38bdb663f?userId=557076&userEmail=zwolfson%40HubSpot.com&associatedObjectId=966566&associatedObjectType=CONTACT&portalId=589323>"  
timestamp = "1661282576723"
concatenate_string = urllib.parse.unquote(f"{method}{url}{timestamp}")
signature_hash = hmac.new(
  CLIENT_SECRET.encode(),
  msg=concatenate_string.encode(),
  digestmod=hashlib.sha256
)
generate_signature = base64.b64encode(signature_hash.digest()).decode('UTF-8')
print(generate_signature)
if generate_signature != incomingSignature:
  print("doesn't match")```

They key was to decode the results of the `b64encode` function since that puts out `bytes` and we need a string. When I did a `print` of the `generate_signature` I got a value that looked like `b'ibkv34cPNpFkw7x0YNdo7DI7K77PawHCQoVGIb/0io4='` which is what tipped me off

For a redirect URI, what specifically does this need to redirect to? I have set up a page for redirects and it ends up on the page with ?code=xxxx added.

Does this need to be receiving GET requests to process the code or what?

Mine is set up to go to a server that I have built that will receive the GET with the code url parameter, and then pass that code along with client secret and client id to the token auth endpoint on the HubSpot api (which returns refresh, access tokens that can be stored and used to authenticate API calls)
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>

is this happening with all create contacts? create a contact with <mailto:nick@deckerdevs.com|nick@deckerdevs.com> — does that give you the same error? Is it only one email address this happens for? What other tests have you done?
<@U038DUUV3GE> Thanks!  It seems to work now, although it worked a week ago the other way. Maybe it was an older deprecated option to just give a list of ids.
oh I think you are right on that. I did an import once and had issues with dates.
That was a migration project and I ended up using a vendor for the migration, but I recall having issues — I don’t remember if I solved that at all
that doesn’t make any sense!
